title: 104_s362
content: The Act titled "Metropolitan Washington Airports Act Amendments of 1995" amends the Metropolitan Washington Airports Act of 1986 to address the increasing need for local planning and management on a metropolitan statistical area basis. The Metropolitan Washington Airports Act of 1986 is amended to establish a board of directors with 11 members appointed by various authorities, including the Governor of Virginia, the Mayor of the District of Columbia, and the Governor of Maryland. The Metropolitan Washington Airports Act of 1986 is amended to establish a board of directors with 11 members appointed by various authorities. The board includes members appointed by representatives from the District of Columbia government and Maryland local governments who are on the Board of Directors of the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments. The Chairman is appointed from among the members by a majority vote and serves without compensation other than reasonable expenses. The board of directors for the Metropolitan Washington Airports Act of 1986 consists of 11 members residing in the Washington Standard Metropolitan Statistical Area. Members serve 4-year terms and require 7 votes to approve bond issues and the annual budget. Proposed actions affecting aircraft noise must be reviewed 60 days in advance to balance environmental protection and air transportation services. The board of directors must notify the Committee on Noise Abatement at National and Dulles Airports 60 days before taking any action, allowing the committee to review and submit comments. The board must also respond to any comments within 30 days. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by sections 2 and 3 of the Act will take effect on the enactment date. Members of the board of directors of the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority appointed before the enactment date will continue to serve until their terms expire. Initial appointments to fill vacancies will be made by the Governor of Virginia and the Virginia State legislature. The Governor of Virginia and Virginia local governments will appoint persons to fill vacancies on the board of directors of the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority. The Mayor of the District of Columbia will also appoint a person to fill a vacancy on the board. Under new provisions, the Columbia government and Maryland Governor will appoint individuals to fill vacancies on the board of directors of the Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority. The definitions in this section clarify the terms "former section 6007(e)" and "new section 6007(e)" as specified in the Metropolitan Washington Airports Act of 1986.
